ã—ã¾ã„ã«ã¯ã€CommonMarkã®ä¸­å¿ƒäººç‰©è‡ªä½“ãŒã€Œãˆã‚‰ã„ã‚‚ã‚“ä½œã£ã¦ã—ã¾ã£ãŸãƒ»ãƒ»ãƒ»ã€ã¨ãªã£ã¦ã„ã¾ã™ã€‚

  • Beyond Markdown

There are 17 principles governing emphasis , for example, and these rules still leave cases undecided. The rules for list items and HTML blocks are also very complex. All of these rules lead to unexpected results sometimes, and they make writing a parser for CommonMark a complex affair. I despair, at times, of getting to a spec that is worth calling 1.0.

 2
 3import (
 4    "C"
 5    "github.com/yuin/gopher-lua"
 6)
 7
 8func Add(L *lua.LState) int {
 9    v1 := L.CheckInt(1)
10    v2 := L.CheckInt(2)
11    L.Push(lua.LNumber(v1 + v2))
12    return 1
13}
14
15func LuaOpenPlugin(L *lua.LState) int {
16    L.Push(
17        L.SetFuncs(L.NewTable(), map[string]lua.LGFunction{
18            "add": Add,
19        }))
20    return 1
21}

item.title: Go+Luaã®ãƒãƒ£ãƒƒãƒˆãƒœãƒƒãƒˆãƒ•ãƒ¬ãƒ¼ãƒ ãƒ¯ãƒ¼ã‚¯ã‚’ä½œã£ãŸ
item.description:
ãŸã¾ã«ã¯å®Ÿç”¨çš„ãªã‚‚ã®ã‚’ã¤ãã‚ã†ã¨æ€ã£ã¦ã€Go+Luaã§ç½®ãã ã‘ã§å‹•ããƒãƒ£ãƒƒãƒˆãƒœãƒƒãƒˆã‚’ä½œã£ã¦ã¿ã¾ã—ãŸã€‚Slack, IRC, Hipchatã‚’ã‚µãƒãƒ¼ãƒˆã—ã¦ã„ã¾ã™ã€‚

ãƒãƒ£ãƒƒãƒˆãƒœãƒƒãƒˆã¨ã„ãˆã°Hubotã ã¨æ€ã„ã¾ã™ãŒã€ã‚‚ã£ã¨ã•ãã£ã¨å‹•ã‹ã—ãŸã„ã¨ã„ã†æ–¹ã«ãŠã™ã™ã‚ã§ã™ã€‚ç½®ã‘ã°ã†ã”ãã¾ã™ã€‚

ç‰¹å¾´ã¯ä»¥ä¸‹ã§ã™ã€‚

  • Goãªã®ã§ç½®ã‘ã°å‹•ã
  • ãã‚Œã§ã„ã¦Luaã§ã‚¹ã‚¯ãƒªãƒ—ãƒˆã‚’æ›¸ã‘ã‚‹
  • æœ€åˆã‹ã‚‰ãƒãƒ«ãƒã‚¹ãƒ¬ãƒƒãƒ‰(è¤‡æ•°goroutine)ã‚’è€ƒæ…®ã—ã¦ã„ã‚‹
  • HTTP(S)ã‚µãƒ¼ãƒæ©Ÿèƒ½ãŒã‚ã‚‹ã®ã§WEBHOOKã‚‚ä¸€ç·’ã«ä½œã‚Œã‚‹
  • å®šæœŸã‚¸ãƒ§ãƒ–ã‚‚æµã›ã‚‹
 1function main()
 2  local bot = golbot.newbot("Slack", { token = "xxxxx" })
 3
 4  bot:respond([[\s*(\d+)\s*\+\s*(\d+)\s*]], function(m, e) -- 3
 5    bot:say(e.target, tostring(tonumber(m[2]) + tonumber(m[3])))
 6  end)
 7
 8  bot:serve(function(msg)
 9    if msg.type == "say" then
10      bot:say(msg.channel, msg.message)
11      respond(msg, true)
12    end
13  end)
14end

ã“ã‚“ãªæ„Ÿã˜ã®ã‚ˆãã‚ã‚‹APIã§ã™ã€‚ç‰¹å¾´çš„ãªã®ãŒworkerã®ä»•çµ„ã¿ã§

 1function main()
 2  bot:respond([[deploy]], function(m, e)
 3    bot:say(e.target, "accepted")
 4    goworker({target=e.target, type="deploy"})
 5  end)
 6
 7  bot:serve(function(msg)
 8    if msg.type == "say" then
 9      bot:say(msg.target, msg.message)
10    end
11  end)
12end
13
14function worker(msg)
15  if msg.type == "deploy" then
16    do_deploy()
17    notifymain({type="say", target=msg.target, message="your deployment has been completed"})
18  end
19end

ã“ã®ã‚ˆã†ã« goworker ã§Luaã‹ã‚‰Goroutineã‚’ã¤ãã£ã¦é‡ã„å‡¦ç†ãªã©ã‚’Workerã§å®Ÿè¡Œã™ã‚‹ã“ã¨ãŒã§ãã¾ã™ã€‚Workerã‹ã‚‰ã¯ notifymain ã§ãƒ¡ã‚¤ãƒ³Groutineã«ãƒ¡ãƒƒã‚»ãƒ¼ã‚¸ã‚’ãŠãã‚‹ã“ã¨ãŒã§ãã¾ã™ã€‚

HTTPã‚µãƒ¼ãƒæ©Ÿèƒ½ã§ã¯ä»¥ä¸‹ã®ã‚ˆã†ãªé–¢æ•°ã‚’å®šç¾©ã™ã‚‹ã ã‘ã§ç°¡å˜ã«WEBHOOKãŒä½œã‚Œã¾ã™ã€‚

 1function http(r)
 2  if r.method == "POST" and r.URL.path == "/webhook" then
 3    local data = assert(json.decode(r:readbody()))
 4    local message = data.item.message.message
 5    local user = data.item.message.from.name
 6    local room = data.item.room.name
 7
 8    local ret = {
 9      message = "hello! from webhook",
10      message_format = "html"
11    }
12
13    return 200, headers, json.encode(ret)
14  end
15  return 400, headers, json.encode({result="not found"})
16end

å®šæœŸã‚¸ãƒ§ãƒ–ã¯ä»¥ä¸‹ã®ã‚ˆã†ãªæ„Ÿã˜ã€‚

 1function main()
 2  golbot.newbot("Null", { 
 3    http = "0.0.0.0:6669" ,
 4    crons = {
 5      { "0 * * * * * ", "job1"}
 6    }
 7  }):serve(function() end)
 8end
 9
10function job1()
11  print "hello!"
12end

ãƒãƒ£ãƒƒãƒˆãƒœãƒƒãƒˆã®ãŸã‚ã ã‘ã«Node.jsã¨npmã¯ã¡ã‚‡ã£ã¨ãƒ»ãƒ»ãƒ»ã¨ã„ã†å ´åˆã«ãœã²ã€‚
